message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Esmolol is a beta-blocker antiarrhythmic medication, and the correct treatment for overdose is glucagon. Insulin is used for an overdose of beta-blockers such as propranolol, not quinidine. Epinephrine is used for an overdose of Class IC antiarrhythmic medications rather than Encainide. Norepinephrine is not used for overdose of Sotalol, which is a non-selective beta-blocker with class III antiarrhythmic properties.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Esmolol is a beta-blocker used as an antiarrhythmic medication, and glucagon is used to treat overdose in this case. Quinidine is treated with sodium bicarbonate, Encainide with lidocaine, and Sotalol with supportive care. Epinephrine and norepinephrine can worsen arrhythmias and are not recommended for treatment.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Esmolol is a beta-blocker and glucagon is used to treat beta-blocker overdose. Quinidine is a Class IA antiarrhythmic and insulin is used to treat overdose caused by hypoglycemia. Encainide is a Class IC antiarrhythmic and epinephrine is not used to treat this overdose. Sotalol is a Class III antiarrhythmic and norepinephrine is not used to treat this overdose.

We refer to a medication reference for help. Esmolol is a beta-blocker used as an antiarrhythmic, and glucagon can be used in overdose situations to counteract the effects of beta-blockers. None of the other options match an appropriate treatment for their respective antiarrhythmic medications.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Esmolol is a beta-blocker that is used as an antiarrhythmic. In the case of overdose, glucagon is used to counteract its effects. Therefore, the correct answer is C. Insulin is used to treat Quinidine overdose, epinephrine for Encainide overdose, and norepinephrine for Sotalol overdose.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Esmolol is a beta-blocker used as an antiarrhythmic and can be treated with glucagon in case of overdose. Quinidine can be treated with sodium bicarbonate, Encainide with lidocaine, and Sotalol with supportive care. Epinephrine is contraindicated in the treatment of Encainide overdose.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Esmolol is a β1-selective adrenergic receptor antagonist and its overdose can cause hypotension and bradycardia, which can be treated with glucagon. Quinidine overdose can lead to hypotension and bradycardia, which can be treated with isoproterenol or pacing. Encainide and flecainide overdose can lead to ventricular arrhythmias and can be treated with lidocaine or phenytoin. Sotalol overdose can lead to torsades de pointes and can be treated with magnesium.

We refer to a medical website for help. Esmolol is a beta-blocker and the treatment for overdose is glucagon. Quinidine is treated with sodium bicarbonate, Encainide with lidocaine or phenytoin, and Sotalol with supportive care.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Esmolol is a beta-blocker and treatment for overdose is glucagon. Quinidine is a class I antiarrhythmic drug and insulin is used to treat hypoglycemia caused by an overdose. Encainide is a class IC antiarrhythmic drug and epinephrine is not used in its overdose treatment. Sotalol is a class III antiarrhythmic drug and norepinephrine is not used in its overdose treatment.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Esmolol is a beta blocker used as an antiarrhythmic medication and glucagon is used to treat its overdose. All other options have mismatched medications and treatments.
